decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources while using powerful creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and True-Name Nemesis to maintain board presence and pressure. It combines disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will with efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares to handle threats. Baleful Strix provides card advantage and protection, while Jace, the Mind Sculptor offers card selection and powerful late game advantage. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent through careful resource management and efficient threats, ultimately grinding out a win through superior control and card advantage.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on using powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, Thought-Knot Seer, and Reality Smasher to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration with cards like Glimmerpost, Cloudpost, and Grim Monolith to ramp into its high-cost threats early in the game. Cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere help disrupt the opponent's game plan while cards like All Is Dust provide board control. The deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and pressure the opponent into submission with its efficient and powerful creatures.

The main concept of this combo - Infect Legacy deck is to use efficient creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf combined with pump spells like Berserk and Become Immense to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent and win the game. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Daze, as well as card selection and ramp with cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Noble Hierarch. The mana base is designed to support the Infect creatures while also having access to key lands like Tropical Island and Wasteland.

The main idea of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly, using cards like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, and then chain together spells to build up a massive storm count. By casting multiple spells in a single turn, the deck aims to finish off the opponent with Tendrils of Agony, dealing a lethal amount of damage. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Duress, Thoughtseize, and Brainstorm to protect the combo and interact with the opponent. The goal is to win the game in one explosive turn.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements such as counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to maintain control of the game. It aims to stabilize the board with efficient threats like Stoneforge Mystic and True-Name Nemesis while also providing resilience with equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull. The deck's win condition is to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage through card draw and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with superior resources and control.

This deck aims to disrupt opponents by utilizing taxing effects like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Rishadan Port, while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Flickerwisp. It leverages powerful lands like Wasteland and Karakas to control the board, while also utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play quickly. The deck also includes powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice to increase the effectiveness of its creatures. Additionally, it can use cards like Recruiter of the Guard to tutor for specific creatures to suit the situation.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Chalice of the Void. It utilizes fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Simian Spirit Guide to accelerate its game plan, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and Endless One. The deck's mana base is optimized for casting Eldrazi spells efficiently, with cards like Cavern of Souls and Eye of Ugin providing additional utility. The inclusion of disruptive elements like Wasteland and Karakas further supports the deck's aggressive strategy.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Hymn to Tourach, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells such as Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, as well as creatures like Baleful Strix and Gurmag Angler. With a mix of card advantage, disruption, and removal, Grixis Control aims to outlast opponents and win through incremental advantage.

The main concept of this Legacy Combo-Storm deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly, using cards like Dark Ritual, Cabal Ritual, and Lotus Petal, in order to cast multiple spells in one turn. By drawing cards with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain, and disrupting the opponent with Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy, the player sets up to either find their win condition in Tendrils of Agony or generate a large army of goblin tokens with Empty the Warrens. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a high storm count and finish the game in a single explosive turn.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly put powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play by using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack, which allows the player to cheat them into play without paying their mana cost. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect these creatures and other key combo pieces. Cunning Wish is used to fetch specific cards from the sideboard, adding versatility to the deck's strategy. The deck focuses on quickly assembling a game-winning combo and disrupting the opponent's plans.

This deck revolves around quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures, then bringing them back into play with spells like Exhume and Reanimate. By using cards like Faithless Looting and Entomb, the deck can set up its combos efficiently. The goal is to cheat out high-powered creatures like Griselbrand and Ashen Rider early in the game, overwhelming the opponent with threats. The deck also includes disruption like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to win through explosive reanimation plays and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the Dark Depths combo by using cards like Vampire Hexmage and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. It also packs disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to control the opponent's hand, as well as removal like Abrupt Decay to deal with threats. The deck's mana base is designed to support the combo with cards like Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and Crop Rotation to find key lands. Overall, the deck aims to quickly execute its combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and card advantage using a combination of elves and spell cards. By using cards like Glimpse of Nature and Heritage Druid, the player can quickly flood the board with creatures, allowing for explosive plays. The deck also features ways to tutor for key creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Archon of Valor's Reach using cards such as Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board state and close out the game with a game-ending creature like Craterhoof Behemoth.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly disrupt and control the opponent while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler. The deck utilizes a mix of removal, counterspells, and card draw to maintain tempo and outmaneuver the opponent. By efficiently utilizing resources and applying constant pressure, this deck aims to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to allow for smooth casting of spells and to maximize consistency in gameplay.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost spells to control the board and apply pressure quickly with efficient creatures like Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Delver of Secrets. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Spell Snare, Spell Pierce, and Force of Will while maintaining board presence with creatures and burn spells like Lightning Bolt. The deck also includes utility cards like Grim Lavamancer and Nivmagus Elemental to provide additional removal and versatility. Overall, the strategy is to win the game through aggressive plays and efficient resource management.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of artifacts and creatures, utilizing cards like Arcbound Ravager and Steel Overseer to quickly build up a threatening board presence. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst, while also having the ability to close out the game quickly with powerful threats like Vault Skirge and Walking Ballista. The mana base includes disruptive lands like Wasteland and Karakas to further disrupt the opponent's strategy.
